ATM, this bit doesn't work in TMS; they have an active bug worked on by Darius Marza, and/or Razvan Moldovan\r\n\r\n * \r\n ** (Question: can we have a case where 2 projects are worked on concurrently and share the same TB? Will revoking the link for one shared termbase affect access from the other project to the same termbase? (AFAIK, we don't really support 2 shared links on the same termbase; when I tried it, I just received the first one. Only for LC, the Entity will from now on be requested on constructor; for MultiTerm providers, the classic behavior is preserved. This Entity object is required to exist (aka: if it's null, there will be an immediate crash) used on *Term Verification*, and when constructing the *available fields* for the 'Hitlist Settings' window (this last one's probably a mistake... fields could and should be retrieved from providers' Definition property.)\r\n\r\nUnfortunately, this solution introduces a weak dependency between MultiTerm and the Language Cloud Provider; there's no real way to avoid that. The reason we have to resort to this kludge is that LC doesn't retrieve Entities from server - it has a local list which stores Entities for current segment. This list has values when Lookup runs (and MultiTerm uses the results to create TermRecognitionHits, which hold the Entity object) and is empty when Term Verification runs.\r\n\r\nStill an open question: how this will impact MultiTrans. I'm not sure the crucial scenarios even apply yet - I don't think MultiTrans even supports Verification Ensure that \"Review retrofit results in the Alignment view before updating\" option is set to ON.\r\n5) Click OK on the prompt to open the alignment file.\r\n\r\nArchive with documents attached (CRQ-6344).\r\n\r\n \r\n\r\nCRQ-12661\r\n # Open Studio.\r\n2. When it is opened again, it checks whether it has been previously closed as minimized, in which case it defaults to the Normal state.\r\n # In this video, as far as I can see (and assume), you have maximized the MultiTrans application, closed it, then reopened it, minimized it, closed it again and the third time, it opened in normal mode but with maximized window dimensions.\r\n ** I explained on the first point why it was opened in normal mode - whenever the application is closed as minimized the next time it is opened it will default to normal mode (not maximized).\r\n ** However, the dimensions of the application window are a different story - whenever the application is minimized, if it is closed in that state, the application window position and dimensions are not saved at all (because minimized applications default to the position X=-320000 Y=-32000 Width = 100 and Height = 80, approximately).\r\n ** So, when reopening MultiTrans after it has been cloased as minimized, it will get the position/dimensions that have been saved last time it was closed without it being minimized (if available; if not available, it takes the default dimensions used right after installing the application).\r\n ** In this example, the last time the application was closed without being in a minimized state, it was maximized, so it saved those dimensions - that's why it's so big when you reopen it after closing it as minimized.\r\n\r\nI have explained this to [~cnistor] and [~msarau] and they gave the green light for closing the issue, if these are the only problems you found, and if the originally described problem (application remains minimized to task bar if it had been closed as minimized) has been fixed.","updateAuthor":{"self":"https://jira.sdl.com/rest/api/2/user?username=bpetrovici","name":"bpetrovici","key":"bpetrovici","emailAddress":"bpetrovici@sdl.com","avatarUrls":{"48x48":"https://jira.sdl.com/secure/useravatar?ownerId=bpetrovici&avatarId=20155","24x24":"https://jira.sdl.com/secure/useravatar?size=small&ownerId=bpetrovici&avatarId=20155","16x16":"https://jira.sdl.com/secure/useravatar?size=xsmall&ownerId=bpetrovici&avatarId=20155","32x32":"https://jira.sdl.com/secure/useravatar?size=medium&ownerId=bpetrovici&avatarId=20155"},"displayName":"Bogdan Petrovici","active":true,"timeZone":"Europe/Bucharest"},"created":"2019-04-19T10:34:41.491+0000","updated":"2019-04-19T10:34:41.491+0000"}],"maxResults":3,"total":3,"startAt":0}}},{"expand":"operations,versionedRepresentations,editmeta,changelog,renderedFields","id":"457234","self":"https://jira.sdl.com/rest/agile/1.0/issue/457234","key":"CRQ-13946","fields":{"parent":{"id":"425056","key":"CRQ-11258","self":"https://jira.sdl.com/rest/api/2/issue/425056","fields":{"summary":"Minimized MultiTerm 2019 cannot be maximized from taskbar by simply clicking on its icon","status":{"self":"https://jira.sdl.com/rest/api/2/status/6","description":"The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. I _think_ it happens when the authentication token expires in the background.\r\n\r\nI've focused on the example URL ([https://languagecloud.sdl.com/translation-toolkit/t/LC-5babebaf0cf2603ee861b2d7?compact=terminologyproviderstudio&langTx=en-AU&langTr=fr-DZ&termId=] ) and tried to narrow down on the code area which launches that request.\r\n\r\nA correct request looks line:  [http://uat-languagecloud.sdl.com/translation-toolkit/t/LC-5bab89190cf20a20aba40766?compact=terminologyproviderstudio&langTx=en&langTr=de&termId=#resources/terminology/5bf6ca7f9b5c45a1a3ace6d4] \r\n\r\nSomething that should be mentioned – *{{termId}} is not the termbase ID*, it's the, uh, term id; it's acceptable for it to be empty, that just means 'Termbase Viewer' won't navigate to a specific term; the *real* request to get the termbase is after the #, the '#resources/terminology/\\{termbaseId} portion. This portion is constructed by AuthenticationService, appended to all requests involving Termbase Viewer, and if it's missing, the current behavior is to show the \"Not enough entitlements available\" message.\r\n\r\nThis _still_ doesn't reproduce the bug, because it won't result in an empty, white Termbase Viewer; it will have the frame for the LC termbase, but there won't be any data in ATM, this bit doesn't work in TMS; they have an active bug worked on by Darius Marza, and/or Razvan Moldovan\r\n\r\n * \r\n ** (Question: can we have a case where 2 projects are worked on concurrently and share the same TB? Costisor","active":true,"timeZone":"Etc/GMT-1"},"body":"[~msarau] & [~dbrockmann] Hello Indeed the fix has been reverted \r\n\r\n[~emacovei] : I think your change in the below PR was meant for LC. I suggest we find a different approach, because while LC needs this for every term hit, Server-based Multiterm Termbases doesn't. After a fuzzy search is done (default) for term recognition, filtering is applied and only then should Termbase.GetEntry(id) be called. This way we will reduce the number of calls to the server (which is the case for 2017)\r\n\r\nhttps://dev.azure.com/sdl/_git/Terminology/commit/5796bc950f911d87ecc597ab578753bde9f90144?refName=refs%2Fheads%2Fmaster&_a=compare&path=%2Fsrc%2FSdl%2FMultiTerm%2FClient%2FTerminologySearch%2FTermRecognitionHit.cs","updateAuthor":{"self":"https://jira.sdl.com/rest/api/2/user?username=bcostisor","name":"bcostisor","key":"bcostisor","emailAddress":"bcostisor@sdl.com","avatarUrls":{"48x48":"https://jira.sdl.com/secure/useravatar?ownerId=bcostisor&avatarId=19356","24x24":"https://jira.sdl.com/secure/useravatar?size=small&ownerId=bcostisor&avatarId=19356","16x16":"https://jira.sdl.com/secure/useravatar?size=xsmall&ownerId=bcostisor&avatarId=19356","32x32":"https://jira.sdl.com/secure/useravatar?size=medium&ownerId=bcostisor&avatarId=19356"},"displayName":"Bogdan Costisor","active":true,"timeZone":"Etc/GMT-1"},"created":"2019-04-05T14:20:00.690+0000","updated":"2019-04-05T14:20:00.690+0000"},{"self":"https://jira.sdl.com/rest/api/2/issue/453938/comment/645483","id":"645483","author":{"self":"https://jira.sdl.com/rest/api/2/user?username=emacovei","name":"emacovei","key":"emacovei","emailAddress":"emacovei@sdl.com","avatarUrls":{"48x48":"https://jira.sdl.com/secure/useravatar?ownerId=emacovei&avatarId=19443","24x24":"https://jira.sdl.com/secure/useravatar?size=small&ownerId=emacovei&avatarId=19443","16x16":"https://jira.sdl.com/secure/useravatar?size=xsmall&ownerId=emacovei&avatarId=19443","32x32":"https://jira.sdl.com/secure/useravatar?size=medium&ownerId=emacovei&avatarId=19443"},"displayName":"Elizabeta Macovei","active":true,"timeZone":"Etc/GMT-1"},"body":"[~bcostisor] Changed call to GetEntity. Only for LC, the Entity will from now on be requested on constructor; for MultiTerm providers, the classic behavior is preserved. This Entity object is required to exist (aka: if it's null, there will be an immediate crash) used on *Term Verification*, and when constructing the *available fields* for the 'Hitlist Settings' window (this last one's probably a mistake... fields could and should be retrieved from providers' Definition property.)\r\n\r\nUnfortunately, this solution introduces a weak dependency between MultiTerm and the Language Cloud Provider; there's no real way to avoid that. The reason we have to resort to this kludge is that LC doesn't retrieve Entities from server - it has a local list which stores Entities for current segment. This list has values when Lookup runs (and MultiTerm uses the results to create TermRecognitionHits, which hold the Entity object) and is empty when Term Verification runs.\r\n\r\nStill an open question: how this will impact MultiTrans. I'm not sure the crucial scenarios even apply yet - I don't think MultiTrans even supports Verification properly.","updateAuthor":{"self":"https://jira.sdl.com/rest/api/2/user?username=emacovei","name":"emacovei","key":"emacovei","emailAddress":"emacovei@sdl.com","avatarUrls":{"48x48":"https://jira.sdl.com/secure/useravatar?ownerId=emacovei&avatarId=19443","24x24":"https://jira.sdl.com/secure/useravatar?size=small&ownerId=emacovei&avatarId=19443","16x16":"https://jira.sdl.com/secure/useravatar?size=xsmall&ownerId=emacovei&avatarId=19443","32x32":"https://jira.sdl.com/secure/useravatar?size=medium&ownerId=emacovei&avatarId=19443"},"displayName":"Elizabeta When it is opened again, it checks whether it has been previously closed as minimized, in which case it defaults to the Normal state.\r\n # In this video, as far as I can see (and assume), you have maximized the MultiTrans application, closed it, then reopened it, minimized it, closed it again and the third time, it opened in normal mode but with maximized window dimensions.\r\n ** I explained on the first point why it was opened in normal mode - whenever the application is closed as minimized the next time it is opened it will default to normal mode (not maximized).\r\n ** However, the dimensions of the application window are a different story - whenever the application is minimized, if it is closed in that state, the application window position and dimensions are not saved at all (because minimized applications default to the position X=-320000 Y=-32000 Width = 100 and Height = 80, approximately).\r\n ** So, when reopening MultiTrans after it has been cloased as minimized, it will get the position/dimensions that have been saved last time it was closed without it being minimized (if available; if not available, it takes the default dimensions used right after installing the application).\r\n ** In this example, the last time the application was closed without being in a minimized state, it was maximized, so it saved those dimensions - that's why it's so big when you reopen it after closing it as minimized.\r\n\r\nI have explained this to [~cnistor] and [~msarau] and they gave the green light for closing the issue, if these are the only problems you found, and if the originally described problem (application remains minimized to task bar if it had been closed as minimized) has been fixed.","updateAuthor":{"self":"https://jira.sdl.com/rest/api/2/user?username=bpetrovici","name":"bpetrovici","key":"bpetrovici","emailAddress":"bpetrovici@sdl.com","avatarUrls":{"48x48":"https://jira.sdl.com/secure/useravatar?ownerId=bpetrovici&avatarId=20155","24x24":"https://jira.sdl.com/secure/useravatar?size=small&ownerId=bpetrovici&avatarId=20155","16x16":"https://jira.sdl.com/secure/useravatar?size=xsmall&ownerId=bpetrovici&avatarId=20155","32x32":"https://jira.sdl.com/secure/useravatar?size=medium&ownerId=bpetrovici&avatarId=20155"},"displayName":"Bogdan Petrovici","active":true,"timeZone":"Europe/Bucharest"},"created":"2019-04-19T10:34:41.491+0000","updated":"2019-04-19T10:34:41.491+0000"}],"maxResults":3,"total":3,"startAt":0}}},{"expand":"operations,versionedRepresentations,editmeta,changelog,renderedFields","id":"457234","self":"https://jira.sdl.com/rest/agile/1.0/issue/457234","key":"CRQ-13946","fields":{"parent":{"id":"425056","key":"CRQ-11258","self":"https://jira.sdl.com/rest/api/2/issue/425056","fields":{"summary":"Minimized MultiTerm 2019 cannot be maximized from taskbar by simply clicking on its icon","status":{"self":"https://jira.sdl.com/rest/api/2/status/6","description":"The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct.
